newsitem.title: USA: J. Baker April same-store sales rose 0.3.
newsitem.headline: J. Baker April same-store sales rose 0.3.

text.p: NOTE: Figures in millions except percentage.
Month is April weeks ended May 3.
Full company name is J. Baker Inc.

The company said its sales decrease was the result of the divestitures of the Shoe Corp of America and Parade of Shoes division In March 1997, as well as the downsizing of its Licensed Discount footwear division.

The company said total sales in its continuing Casual Male, Work n'Gear and Licensed Discount division for the four weeks ended May 3, 1997 were $40 million compared to $41 million for the four weeks ended May 4, 1996. For the month of April, same-store sales increased 0.3 percent.
